definition: the act of moving your body into a lower position by bending one or both knees, as a sign of respect in a church
the act of showing too much respect to somebody/something
a bird with a long beak that catches fish in rivers. The European kingfisher is small and brightly coloured and the American kingfisher is larger and blue-grey in colour.
a small brown bird, the male of which has a beautiful song
relating to or connected with the abdomen
sudden and unexpected, often in an unpleasant way
speaking or acting in a way that seems rude and unfriendly; not taking time to say more than is necessary
a block of stone on which a column or statue stands
a place to live, work or stay in
somewhere to live or stay, often also providing food or other services
an agreement or arrangement between people or groups with different opinions that is acceptable to everyone; the process of reaching this agreement
the way in which the lens (= a part of the eye) becomes flatter or thicker in order to create a clear image of the object that you want to look at
to be very busy and active trying to do something, but not very organized, with the result that you do not succeed
demanding total attention or love; not wanting somebody to be independent
not liking to lend things or share things with others
showing that something belongs to somebody/something
